name: Borgmann Villa Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was great, the rooms were really clean and airy, nice bathrooms. Staff were pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice room shame about the breakfast
Recommended for those seeking the peaceful side of Amsterdam
reviews.text: Whilst the hotel was not near the centre of Amsterdam it was only a fifteen minute walk through the park to get to Leides plein. It was really hot and sunny whilst we visited so it was lovely to spend time reading and lounging around in the park.

reviews.title: The Reviews are True!
reviews.text: The only thing that really let the place down were the breakfasts. We hadn't noticed when we booked that the breakfasts cost another ten euro on top of the room rate and we were only informed by the hotel on checking out.

reviews.title: A Quiet and Quaint Retreat in a City of Activity
reviews.text: Luckily the breakfast was so bad on the first morning we spent there that we ate elsewhere for subsequent days and saved ourselves 60 euros (we were charged for the first day). The hotel had ran out of most things on the breakfast buffet and so I ended up paying 10 euros for a boiled egg and a coffee. It took twenty minutes to even get the coffee as the receptionist was dealing with both the food and guests checking out.

reviews.title: Good value for money
reviews.text: The breakfasts were very basic and I mean very basic, no croissant, toast or anything similar, just sliced bread, ham, cheese and cereal, really bad value for money. The cafe across the road was cheaper and offered more. It seemed a real shame as the hotel was great and I'd have stayed again quite happily, however I think that by the time you add the price of breakfast to the room charge it works out expensive in comparison to other places. (I have stayed at the Schipol Hilton with breakfast included cheaper than this hotel.)

reviews.title: Wonderful Staff!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Borgmann Villa after reading previous reviews on TripAdvisor and we were very happy with our choice. My boyfriend and I found it very easy to get to from the #2 tram (a short walk from Emmastraat stop). We loved the location at the edge of Vondelpark, away from the noise of the city. The room was very clean with bright windows overlooking the street. On our last day at the hotel, we were supposed to catch an early flight and ww overslept that morning, thus missing our flight. The nice woman working at the desk really helped me out and let me use the phone and internet to arrange my new flight schedule. We had to stay in Amsterdam another night, but their hotel was fully booked that evening, so she called around to other hotels and found us a place a block away at a reasonable rate. I really appreciated all their patience and help during that stressful time. I highly recommend this hotel...truly a gem in Amsterdam!

reviews.title: A Hidden Hotel Gem of Amsterdam
reviews.text: Borgmann Villa Hotel is a small, moderately-priced, charming, owner-operated/managed hotel in a quiet residential neighborhood bordering the southside of beautiful VondelPark in Amsterdam and is extremely convenient to the city's major entertainment and cultural areas. The hotel is only a two minute walk from the city tram system and car parking (for a daily fee) directly in front of the hotel (a rare commodity in Amsterdam) is available. The hotel has secured entry, but guests have access during all hours.

reviews.title: Great location and friendly service
reviews.text: I had two separate ocassions to stay at Borgmann Villa and both times I found the accomodations to be clean, bright, quiet and comfortable. Rooms are equipped with remote control TV, telephone, hairdryer, private bath and/or shower (with plenty of hot water) and a nicely stocked mini-bar. A continental-style breakfast buffet and Wifi internet connection are available for a nominal fee. I would suggest notifying the hotel in advance if you want Wifi service as some locations in the hotel have better signal reception than others, though.

reviews.title: Feel like Home
reviews.text: The friendly personal service and attention by the owners and small staff is exceptional... so much so that I found the hotel to be operated more as a bed & breakfast than a hotel. Upon check-in, as well as throughout my stay, I was updated on any sightseeing or special events that I might be interested in during my stay in Amsterdam.

reviews.title: Borgmann brilliant hotel!
reviews.text: When I return to Amsterdam, I will definately be contacting Borgmann Villa Hotel for reservations!

I stayed in the Borgmann for an extended weekend with my wife. I know the hotels in Amsterdam pretty well, since I go there for work every month and I challenge you to find such a treat elsewhere: a cozzy hotel located in one of the nicest areas of Amsterdam, 20 minutes walk from the center, with such a thoughtful and nice staff, with a very reasonable rate. I felt like I was staying with relatives! The only caveat is the breakfast, which costs too much for what you get, even thought the view of the park may compensate for the difference. My wife caught a strong cold during our stay and the staff did everything they could to help us out: find a physician on a Saturday night, give us directions to the only pharmacy open and boil water for us every day, twice a day. Unheard of in any other hotel I stayed, besides the big 5 stars my company pays for me once in a while.

reviews.title: Cozy Nook, That

description: Borgmann Villa Hotel is old brick villa with large windows, tastefully modernised with pale decor, located in quiet leafy area, right on the border of the Vondel Park (Amsterdam's most famous park with a variety of outdoor activities such as biking, hiking, jogging and picnicking. A little distant from city-center attractions, more suitable for longer holiday or those seeking tranquility.
